dev.jeka.core.api.java.project

Class JkJavaProject

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.jeka.core.api.java.project.JkJavaProject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JkJavaIdeSupport.JkSupplier

    public class JkJavaProject
extends java.lang.Object
implements JkJavaIdeSupport.JkSupplier
    A Java project consists in 3 parts :
    • JkJavaProjectJarProduction : responsible to compile, tests and make jars
    • JkJavaProjectDocumentation : responsible to creates javadoc, sources jar and others
    • JkJavaProjectPublication : responsible to publish the artifacts on binary repositories (Maven or Ivy)
    Each of these parts are optional. This mean that you don't have to set the publication part if the project is not supposed to be published. Or you don't have to set the production part if the project publishes artifacts that are created by other means than the production part.

    JkJavaProject defines base and output directories as they are shared with the 3 parts.
